com.github.amlcurran.showcaseview

Interface ShowcaseDrawer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MaterialShowcaseDrawer, NewShowcaseDrawer, StandardShowcaseDrawer

    public interface ShowcaseDrawer
    Class to implement your own drawing of a showcase view, should you want more control. See the other implementations for examples

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawShowcase(android.graphics.Bitmap buffer, float x, float y, float scaleMultiplier)
      Draw the showcase.
      void drawToCanvas(android.graphics.Canvas canvas, android.graphics.Bitmap bitmapBuffer)
      Draw the commands drawn to the canvas.
      void erase(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmapBuffer)
      Remove all drawing on the bitmap.
      float getBlockedRadius() 
      int getShowcaseHeight() 
      int getShowcaseWidth() 
      void setBackgroundColour(int backgroundColor)
      Set the background color of the showcase.
      void setShowcaseColour(int color)
      Sets the value of the showcase color from themes.

    • Method Detail

      • setShowcaseColour

        void setShowcaseColour(int color)
        Sets the value of the showcase color from themes. What this does is dependent on your implementation of drawShowcase(Bitmap, float, float, float)
        Parameters:
        color - the color supplied in the theme

      • drawShowcase

        void drawShowcase(android.graphics.Bitmap buffer,
                  float x,
                  float y,
                  float scaleMultiplier)
        Draw the showcase. How this is performed is up to you!
        Parameters:
        buffer - the bitmap to draw onto
        x - the x position of the point to showcase
        y - the y position of the point to showcase
        scaleMultiplier - a scale factor. Currently unused

      • getShowcaseWidth

        int getShowcaseWidth()
        Returns:
        the width of the showcase, used to calculate where to place text

      • getShowcaseHeight

        int getShowcaseHeight()
        Returns:
        the height of the showcase, used to calculate where to place text

      • getBlockedRadius

        float getBlockedRadius()
        Returns:
        the radius to block touches outside of, if ShowcaseView.setBlocksTouches(boolean) is set

      • setBackgroundColour

        void setBackgroundColour(int backgroundColor)
        Set the background color of the showcase. What this means is up to your implementation, but typically this should be the color used to draw in erase(Bitmap)

      • erase

        void erase(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmapBuffer)
        Remove all drawing on the bitmap. Typically, this would do a color fill of the background color. See StandardShowcaseDrawer for an example
        Parameters:
        bitmapBuffer - the Bitmap to erase drawing from

      • drawToCanvas

        void drawToCanvas(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                  android.graphics.Bitmap bitmapBuffer)
        Draw the commands drawn to the canvas. Typically this is a single implementation, see StandardShowcaseDrawer.
        Parameters:
        canvas - canvas to draw to
        bitmapBuffer - bitmap to draw
